agents

Class Agent_simple

  • java.lang.Object
    • agents.Agent_simple
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Agent

    public class Agent_simple
extends java.lang.Object
implements Agent
    The Agent_simple is a first version of the agent in the new implementation of the protocol. The aim of Agent_simple is to argument over and resolve all kinds of disagreement arrising on one level of meaning. When we refer to "disagreement on one level of meaning", we mean on an inconsistant distribution of term symbols for one of the agents' features. The rest of the agents' features have to be consistent (i.e they should name the same things the same way). A consequence of this is the necessity to have a shared ontology on anything different than one set of symbols that will be discussed.
    Author:
    kemoadrian

      • initialPhase

        public Phase initialPhase()
        First phase of an argumentation, sends the intensional definitions of all the Concepts to the other Agent.
        Returns:
        the Phase.BuildHypothesisState.

      • buildHypothesisPhase

        public Phase buildHypothesisPhase()
        Second phase of an argumenation, build a Hypothesis with the intensional definitions of this Agent (marked *) and the other Agent's ones (marked °), thanks to the Messages received during the initial phase.
        Returns:
        the Phase.ExpressAgreementState.

      • expressAgreementState

        public Phase expressAgreementState()
        Third phase of an argumentation, the Agreement values for each couple of Concepts between this Agent's Concepts, and the other {code Agent}'s Concepts in the Hypothesis is sent to the other Agent.
        Returns:
        the Phase.ModifyAgreementState.

      • modifyAgreementStatePhase

        public Phase modifyAgreementStatePhase()
        Fourth phase of an argumentation, the Agreement values for each couple of the Concepts evaluated during a expressAgreementState is modified, according to the values received from the other Agent.
        Returns:
        the Phase.ArgumentationStartState.

      • argumentationStartPhase

        public Phase argumentationStartPhase()
        Fifth phase of an argumentation, the Discussion is created in order to reduce the number of disagreements. The priority order of disagreement solving is respected. Where no disagreement is found the agent stops the discussion and go decide a final vocabulary for the ContrastSet.
        Returns:
        Phase.VoteForSignState if there is no more disagreement, Phase.ArgumentationInitializeExtension otherwise.

      • argumentationInitializeExtension

        public Phase argumentationInitializeExtension()
        Sixth phase of an argumentation, the Agent creates the Extensional definitions for a new Concept that would lead to an agreement on the meaning. According to the relation of Hierarchy detected between the two Concept during the conversation's initialization, the Agreement of the Discussion can change. An Intensional definition is created by inductive learning using ABUI in order to produce a base for the AMAIL argumentation during the next phase.
        Returns:
        the Phase.ArgumentationCoreState.

      • argumentationCorePhase

        public Phase argumentationCorePhase()
        Seventh phase of an argumentation, the Agent uses AMAIL to generate a new Intensional definition for a new Concept that would satisfy him and the Attacker.
        Returns:
        Phase.WaitingAgreementState if the Discussion is solved, Phase.WaitingAgreementState otherwise.

      • waitAgreementPhase

        public Phase waitAgreementPhase()
        Eighth phase of an argumentation, the Agent adds/delets Concepts from its current ContrastSet. The Concepts are added/deleted according to the Concept obtained after the Argumentation Core Phase, the Agreement of the Discussion and the rest of the ContrastSet. For each Concept added, an Evaluate is sent to the Attacker. For each Concept deleted, a Forget is sent to the Attacker.
        Returns:
        the Phase.ModifyAgreementState.

      • voteForSignPhase

        public Phase voteForSignPhase()
        Ninth phase of an argumentation, the Agent votes for the Signs of each final Concept present in the ContrastSet.
        Returns:
        the Phase.ChangeSignState.

      • changeSignPhase

        public Phase changeSignPhase()
        Tenth phase of an argumentation, the Agent might change the Signs of its Concepts according to the results of the vote that occured in the Phase.VoteForSignState.
        Returns:
        the Phase.Stop.

      • stop

        public Phase stop()
        The final Phase of the argumentation. The script that instantiates the two Agents can now terminate.
        Returns:
        the Phase.Stop
